summary: This document is an email chain from August 2021 discussing a victim's case related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves an FBI Victim Specialist and others coordinating a call to discuss the victim's eligibility for compensation and reimbursement for therapy costs. It reveals ongoing victim assistance efforts years after Epstein's crimes.

persons.name: Cristal
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist at the Los Angeles Field Office who is coordinating assistance for a victim of Epstein, discussing therapy reimbursement and compensation applications.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Person being contacted by Cristal to discuss a victim's case, specifically regarding victim compensation and therapy reimbursement.

persons.name: Nadia
persons.context: Epstein victim referenced in the email subject line; the discussion centers on her need for therapy and financial assistance.

connections.description: Colleagues or contacts coordinating a conference call to discuss a victim's case and compensation options.
FBI Victim Specialist providing support and guidance to an Epstein victim regarding therapy and financial compensation.

events.title: Coordination for Victim Case Call
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a conference call to discuss an Epstein victim's eligibility for victim compensation and therapy reimbursement.

keyFacts: An FBI Victim Specialist is actively assisting an Epstein victim with therapy reimbursement and compensation applications in August 2021.
The victim was victimized in multiple locations: New York City (NYC), Florida (FL), and New Mexico (NM).
The victim is struggling to pay for therapy sessions costing $300/hour and is paying out of pocket.
The email discusses the victim's potential eligibility for the New York Victim Compensation program and the FEVAF (possibly a typo for a victim assistance fund) for therapy reimbursement.
The correspondence indicates that many attorneys have spoken directly to OVS (Office of Victim Services).
